    • Method Detail

      • saveUser

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                path="/users/new",
                produces="application/json")
public java.lang.String saveUser​(@RequestBody
                                 User user)
        Saves a new user into the database.
        Parameters:
        user - - The user being added.
        Returns:
        - The Net-ID of the user being added.

      • getAllUsers

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                path="/users")
public java.util.List<User> getAllUsers()
        Gets a list of all the users in the database.
        Returns:
        - A list of all the users in the database.

      • findUserByNetID

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                path="/users/{net_id}")
public User findUserByNetID​(@PathVariable("net_id")
                            java.lang.String net_id)
        Very important "helper" method. Finds the respective user corresponding to the NetID being entered in.
        Parameters:
        net_id - - The NetID of the user we are looking for.
        Returns:
        - The user corresponding to the NetID, assuming that it exists.

      • getCodeByNetID

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                path="/users/{code}")
public java.lang.Integer getCodeByNetID​(@PathVariable("net_id")
                                        java.lang.String net_id)
        Primarily for testing purposes. Gets the 'code' column from the respective user.
        Parameters:
        net_id - - The NetID of the user who we're checking the code from.
        Returns:
        userCode - The code of the user.

      • setUserEnteredCode

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                path="users/{entered_code}")
public void setUserEnteredCode​(@RequestBody
                               java.lang.Integer entered_code,
                               @PathVariable("net_id")
                               java.lang.String net_id)
        When the user enters the code on the app and hits submit, it will both enter the entered_code into the database and check if the entered_code matches the code. If so, then the user is "verified".
        Parameters:
        entered_code - - The code (received through email) that is entered in by the user.
        net_id - - The NetID of the user entering the code.
